line.en: If you fly too high, you'll fall.
I learned that as a child... that it was fact\nabout humans, who have no wings.
Superior humans are born with wings and can fly\nfreely through the sky, so even if they get\ncarried away, they can still fly.
The higher they get, the more energy they seem to\nhave, and they dance gracefully through the\natmosphere.
But I'm just an ordinary person, with no wings...
I'll fall.
I always fall.
Hmmm.
I wonder if Asa's okay. She seemed really\ndepressed...
It's true that she made a mistake, but it really\nwasn't something to make a big deal about.
If she's working herself up too much about it, I\nwant to cheer her up.
...I think I'll go check on her.
Knock knock
'Asa? Are you there?'
Click
'What is it?'
'I was just wondering if Asa was there.'
'She's not.'
'Huh?'
Not there... at this hour?
It was already past 10 PM.
'I think she's gone there.'
'There?'
'I tried to stop her, but she went out.'
'Asa.'
...She was really there.
Just as Yoru had said, Asa was in the secret\nbase.
Her eyes were red and swollen, as though she'd\nbeen crying.
'What are you doing here...?'
'Yoru said you'd probably be here.'
She'd actually said that Asa was probably either\nhere or on Windmill Hill.
'Yoru...'
Her voice sounded a little hoarse.
I wonder how long she'd been crying here by\nherself.
'Are you okay?'
'Ah, yeah. I've pretty much cried myself out.'
'Heh heh.'
She was trying to look brave...
But there were still tears in the corners of her\neyes.
'Ever since I was really little, I've come here\nfrom time to time.'

'When I was just tired of the atmosphere at home,
or when something sad happened, or when I was
worried about something... whenever I wanted to
be alone, I came here.'
'On the way home, I'd watch the windmills. And\nthen the next day I'd tell myself that I could\ntry again.'
'I'm sorry... Was I interrupting?'
'No, it's totally fine! Actually, I'm happy.'
'Even though I caused so much trouble. You still\ncame all the way out here...'
'I've told you so many times already, but you\ndidn't cause any trouble, okay? It wasn't a big\ndeal, and everyone makes mistakes.'
'...It's a big deal to me. It's not a big deal,\nbut it is... There are just too many things that\nfeel that way to me now.'
'Too many?'
'Mistakes, and failures. I'm really bad at\nhandling them.'
'I've always always felt that I can't afford to\nmake mistakes.'
'You mean you're a perfectionist?'
Asa seemed very sensitive to everything in life.
Whether or not she was a perfectionist, she\nseemed very high strung.
'No, it's not that...'
'...I'm scared. Of failing.'
'Failing?'
Asa nodded.

'I've always been afraid of failure. I always
felt that if I made a mistake, people would get
mad at me, or look down on me, or stop noticing
me at all.'
'I've always, always, ALWAYS felt like that, as\nlong as I can remember.'
'So this time you feel the same way?'
'...It makes me hate myself. Most of the time\nit's my own fault when I mess up, because my\nfeelings make me stumble.'
'That happened this time, too. Things were going\nso well lately, so busy and lively, that I felt\nlike I could do anything.'
'So I got carried away, and made the order in\nthat light frame of mind, and made a mistake, and\nthis is the result.'
'Everyone gets carried away sometimes. I do too.'

'But it's no good. When normal people get carried
away, they fall. They'll fall, so they've got to
control themselves. But I didn't... I got too
high...'
She must have some sort of complex.
Listening to her, I realized that she blamed\nherself, and sometimes hated herself.
'I'm no good. I don't have a knack or a talent\nfor anything. I'm no good to anyone.'
'My parents, my grandparents, and my aunts,\nuncles and cousins...'
'Everyone around me is so smart. They're amazing.\nThey can do anything.'
'But I...'
I'm not Asa, so it would be impossible for me to\nfully understand her.
But from what I could tell, there were just too\nmany people who excelled gathered around her.
Maybe her rich family only seemed to be similar\nto others, but was really a different world.
So perhaps it was an environment where an average\nperson was more conspicuous.
'The reason I admire the sky is because I hoped\nthat someday I could fly, just like everyone\nelse.'

'And I was drawn to Soaring Club because I
thought I could fit in there, since I already
loved the sky, and that I could find a place
where I belonged.'

'There was nothing that was important to me
before; nothing I was passionate about. So I
wanted to find a dream to hold on to, and that's
when I found the glider... That's why.'
'That's why...'
Asa just wanted to find a dream.
An environment where she could find wings of her\nown, and where she could work hard towards that\ngoal.
And when she finally found that dream, she worked\nhard and thought things were going well, but then\nshe made a mistake.
So it hurt her even more than before.
'I'm so... sorry...'
I could only guess at what she was feeling,\nbut...
'...I think that's okay.'
'Huh?'
'I think it's okay. For you to worry about that.\nTo get sad when you make a mistake. To be bad at\nhanding failure.'
'As long as you can keep moving forward, a little\nat a time.'

'I mean, I don't really understand exactly what's
upsetting you so much, but I think everyone has
their own reactions to things... And that's why I
want to help you.'
'Would that be okay?'

'I'm sure you'll find what you're good at, and
what's important to you. Even if you don't know
now, even if you feel like you're losing to those
around you.'
'I've lost my own dream once before. But I'm\nworking hard again now. And I'm sure I'll make\nmistakes again in the future.'
'And of course that'll keep happening, so I think\ngetting upset like this is something that will\nhappen a lot.'
'But I want to cheer you on.'
Pat, pat, stroke.
'So cheer up a little, okay? And if you make\nanother mistake that you feel bad about, I'll\nlisten to what you have to say, if you let me.'
'And as I said, nobody's mad at you.'
'Thank you so, so much, Aoi.'
How can I explain it?
When Asa burst out into tears once more at this\npoint, she was so fragile, so brave, and so\nvulnerable.
I felt that I had an obligation to protect this\ngirl.
'You're late! Both of you!'
'Aoi, if you went to bring her back, why didn't\nyou come straight home? It's almost midnight.'
'...Hey Kanako, Yoru...'
When we got back to the dorm, the two of them\nwere waiting for us.
'Welcome back, Sis.'
'...Thanks.'
'Kanako, you noticed we were gone?'
'I was worried about Asa, so I went to her room,\nand Yoru told me she'd gone out.'
'And then she said you'd gone out after her, too.\nSo I waited for you to get back. I was worried,\nyou know?'
'Thank you, Kanako.'
'Th, thank you, Kanako.'
'...Are you feeling better now?'
'Y, yes. Thanks.'
'Good!'
She looked at Asa's face and smiled brightly.
Asa's eyes were hugely swollen from crying for so\nlong, making quite a pitiful sight.
But she also somehow looked fresh and clear, like\na sky after the rain has passed.
'But Asa, I realize that you were upset, but it's\ndangerous for a girl to walk by herself at night,\nokay?'
'W, well...'
'I understand that you want to be alone when\nyou're sad, but common sense should tell you not\nto go out at night alone like that.'
'It makes more trouble for the rest of us, too,\nso please don't do it again.'
'...Alright.'
'As long as you understand!'
Kanako really did make a good older sister\nfigure.
'Um, Aoi?'
'Yes?'
'Thank you. For helping my sister.'
'...Nah, I didn't really do anything. I just went\nto go find her, that's all.'
'But still.'
'Thank you for going in my place to bring her\nhome.'
'It's okay, really. It's dangerous out there for\nyou too, right?'
'You really are kind, Aoi.'
'Huh?'
I was startled to be so directly complimented by\nYoru.
'...No, it's nothing. But thank you, really.'
Morning.
I forced open my heavy eyelids, and waited for my\nbrain to clear and awaken.
I'm used to early mornings. I'm pretty good at\ngetting up early.
I used to get up early to take my bike out for a\nride and train for road races.
This time I got up, got dressed, and left my\nroom.
'Ah... Good morning, Aoi.'
When I came down to the living room, I found Asa\npreparing the breakfast I'd been planning to\nmake.
'Huh? Why are you...?'
'You told me the recipe yesterday, so I knew what\nyou were going to make.'
'I thought I'd help.'
'I see. Thanks, Asa.'
'Heh heh. Okay, I've peeled the vegetables for\nthe miso soup. What should I do next?'
'Let's see... I need the leeks chopped. Can you\ndo that?'
'I'll do my best!'
A few days later.
Asa had made a full recovery, and was back to her\ncheerful self.
It was hard to imagine how depressed she'd been\nso recently.
'Aoi, do you really want to make Szechuan tofu\nthis early in the day?'
'Hmm? Why not?'
'Oh, no, I like it a lot so it doesn't bother me,\nbut...'
The main dish of today's breakfast was Szechuan\ntofu.
Was it too spicy for breakfast? I'm still not\nvery good at this type of thing. Hmm...
But tofu is healthy... Or maybe that didn't\nmatter.
'There are really a lot of kinds of miso, aren't\nthere?'
Asa was looking a large variety of Chinese miso\nflavors.

I think this is true of most foods, but for
Szechuan tofu especially, there's a huge
difference in flavor if you make it from scratch
instead of from a packet.
So no matter how little I actually used each one,\nI had a good collection of seasonings for Chinese\ndishes like Szechuan tofu.
'But each one has a very different flavor. Using\nthese effectively is the secret to Chinese\ncooking.'
Asa looked interested.
'Asa?!'
'I- I cut my finger...'
'Oh dear, show me... It's not deep, but you\nshould put a band-aid on it. Just a second.'
I got a band-aid from the first aid kit.
'I really do fall each time I get carried away...\nUugh.'
'Well, mistakes happen all the time. Show me your\nfinger again.'
'Ah, okay... Whoa! Aoi!'
I took a hold of Asa's finger and put it in my\nmouth.
'...Ah, umm, Aoi...'
'Hmm?'
'Uh, that's kind of embarrassing...'
'...Ah, I guess so. I've always done this to\nsterilize cuts, so I just did it without\nthinking...'
I stopped sucking on Asa's finger.
Come to think of it, I'd never done that to a\ngirl before.
'N, no. It's not... a problem... Um, the\nband-aid?'
'Eh, ah, yeah. Sorry. Um, here.'
I gave Asa the band-aid.
She wrapped it carefully around the cut finger.
'That should do it.'
'Okay, I'll keep cutting...'
'Be careful not to put pressure on that finger.\nIt'll hurt.'
'Right!'
'Don't let the little mistake get you down! Just\ntry again!'
'I'm okay this time. Recently there have been\nmore happy things than depressing things anyway.'
'Really? Like what?'
'Yeah?'
'No, it's nothing.'
'What is it?'
'I, I said it's nothing!'
After school. We were going to our club.
'Alright, let's go!'
Today, Kanako was coming with us.
She'd caught us as we were leaving the school\ngate, saying she'd come along.
'Will you help us out today?'
'Well, the stiffening agent is supposed to arrive\ntoday, right? So I thought I'd come and help to\nget things moving faster.'
'Ah, I see. That'll be a big help.'
'Don't worry about it.'
'Thank you so much!'
Asa bowed her head deeply.
The stiffening agent was the thing that Asa\nhadn't ordered correctly before.
'And I want to see how you look at your club,\nAsa!'
'Whaa?!'
'Well, that's how it is. I'll be helping!'
'Just don't tease Asa too much and slow us down,\nokay?'
'I won't, I won't. Don't worry. Huh? Where's\nYoru?'
Since Yoru wasn't a Soaring member, it shouldn't\nbe strange if she wasn't there, but recently\nshe'd been coming every day.
She'd been coming so consistently that it felt\nweird when she didn't.
'Yoru said she wanted to stop somewhere else\nfirst, and left for Windy's.'
'I offered to go with her, but she said she had\nan errand that she wanted to do by herself...'
'If Yoru wanted to go to Windy's, she could have\ntold us beforehand.'
'Huh? Why?'

'I was planning to go there too. I want to stop
at the bookstore, and even more importantly, I
have to go pick up the stiffening agent from
An-chan.'
'Ah, right.'
'Shall I come along too?'
'Nah, I'll just run there really quick by myself,\nso you all can go straight on to the dock.'
'You can get started working there.'
I wanted to stop at the bookstore, and it would\nalso be easier for me to pick up the supply by\nmyself.
It came in an 18-liter drum, so it'd be heavy,\nbut I could handle it.
'Okay!'
'Hurry back!'
So I left the others and headed to the factory.
'Here's the supply you ordered.'
'Thanks for helping out all the time, An-chan.'
'No problem! See you!'
After getting the stiffening agent and thanking\nAn-chan again, I continued on to Windy's.
I just wanted to pick up one thing, a magazine\nI'd been planning to buy.
...But, wait a sec.
It would have been a lot easier if I'd picked up\nthe book first, and then got to get the heavy\nsupplies on my way back.
'...Too late now.'
I headed to the exit, mumbling to myself.
Okay, I had to hurry back to the dock where\neveryone was waiting...
...Huh?
Wait, was that Yoru?
What was she doing?
'I already told you, I'm not going. I'm not\ninterested.'

'This isn't about being interested! For the sake
of the sports festival and other school events,
we're gathering all the girls in our class who
have free time, to strengthen our friendship and
teamwork!'
'We've already decided! So if you've got any\ntime, Kazato, we want you to come join us for\nkaraoke! That's what I'm trying to explain!'
I saw Yoru sitting in a cafe in Windy's,\nsurrounded by other girls.
I vaguely recognized the other girls... I think\nthey were Yoru's classmates.
'And if you just selfishly ignore us and turn us\ndown, that's a problem for everybody! You\nunderstand? You're letting everyone down!'
'Look, Yoru. Can't you just hang out with the\nrest of us from time to time?'
'...Sorry, I'll pass.'
'I just don't see that as a valuable use of my\ntime. And time's not something I want to waste.\nSo I'll pass.'
'What's that supposed to mean?! There you go\nagain, being so selfish!'
'I don't want to waste my time.'
They seemed to be arguing.
It didn't seem right to cut in on their\nconversaton, so I just watched for a bit.
...It would be difficult to just ignore it and\nmove on at this point.
'I don't like pretending to be friends, or a\nteam. You're all just acting all familiar with\neach other and gloating about yourselves.'
'None of it seems real to me.'
'But I'd really like to get to know you, Yoru!\nWe're in the same class now, after all...'
'...Sorry. I don't feel that way.'
With that, Yoru tried to leave.
But one of the girls blocked Yoru's way.
'Listen, you, do you know who this girl likes?'
'W, wait, Azuma!'
'...(sigh) What is this, all of the sudden?'
'She likes Eiji! So she gathered up all her\ncourage and told him so!'
'But he told her he likes you instead. And then\nyou turned him down, didn't you?!'
'Yeah. What about it?'
'Despite all that, she still wants to invite you!\nWe told her not to bother with you, but she still\nwanted to ask you! That's why we're asking you!'
'Why can't you try to understand that?'
'I'm sorry. It's not that I don't understand.\nBut.. that's another matter.'
'Please don't invite me again.'
'You!!'
The girls were trying to surround Yoru.
'Wait a second!'
I jumped in between them.
'Eh, uh, who...?'
The girls looked dumbfounded.
That was understandable. There was no reason they\nshould know me.
'Umm... I'm Yoru's senpai in Soaring Club, Aoi\nMinase. Nice to meet you.'
'...Soaring Club?'
'...Senpai?'
The girls looked totally blank.
Apparently they were surprised to hear that Yoru\nwas in a club.
'Today, the Soaring Club has some very important\nactivities, and we need Yoru to come help us with\nthem.'
'But Aoi, I'm not in the So... mmff!'
Yoru tried to object, but I covered her mouth.
'Soaring Club has been really busy lately, so she\nprobably hasn't had much time to hang out, but\nplease try to understand, okay?'
'Ah... Uhhh... Err, yeah...'
'Yoru... You're in Soaring Club... I didn't\nknow.'
'So anyway, sorry. I'll be taking her with me\nnow. Bye!'
I turned my back to the astonished girls, and\ngrabbed Yoru's hand. And then...
'And for the record, she's not a mean girl! She\njust comes across that way sometimes! Don't worry\nabout it!'
I left them with that last message, and headed\nfor the exit from Windy's.
'What was all that about just now?'
'Well, you seemed to be in trouble, so I saved\nyou...'
'I don't recall asking for your help!'
Yoru made a cross face and turned away from me.
'And why did you say I was in Soaring Club? I\ndon't remember ever joining up.'
'I thought that'd be the easiest way to explain.'
'It's one thing now during summer vacation, but\nonce school has started up again, I'm the one\nwho's going to have to deal with that lie!'
'I'll either have to keep faking it, or admit the\ntruth. Either way, I'm going to have to deal with\nthat lie you told.'
She was right.
Those girls might keep asking her about Soaring.
'(sigh) Whatever. I guess I'll just fake it.'
'...Why don't you just go ahead and join\nalready?'
'Nope.'
I guess she really didn't want to join.
Even though nothing bad would happen if she did.
'Anyway, I suppose I should thank you. Apparently\nyou were trying to rescue me.'
'...Thank you, Aoi.'
'I thought you were angry.'
'I may think they're annoying, but I don't get\nangry at people who are trying to help me.'
'...So you think I'm annoying?'
'Could be.'
Yoru purposefully refused to answer.
I'd be a bit hurt if she really did think that\nabout me.
'You're really nosy, aren't you, Aoi?'
'You think so?'

'You stick your nose into things that have
nothing to do with you, and say your piece. You
didn't have to think that hard about my sister
the other day either.'
'But I was worried.'
'That's what I'm saying. You're nosy.'
Maybe she was right.
I'd never thought of it that way, but...
'And just now, you could have just pretended not\nto see and gone on your way, right?'
'That would be heartless. There's no way I could\nignore my cute junior in trouble.'
'I wasn't really in trouble, though.'
'You're so softhearted, Aoi.'
'I especially don't get what you said at the end.\nAbout me being mean or not.'
'But you're not a mean girl. I thought it'd be a\nshame if you seemed that way.'
'It's not a shame to me.'
'It seems like a waste to me. It seems unfair.\nYou're cute, Yoru, and you're a good girl.'
'What does that have to do with you?!'
'Don't get so angry! Your face is bright red!'
'... It's not red because I'm angry! It's because\nyou're embarrassing me!'
'Eh... Ah, ooohhh...'
I guess she was right.
When I thought back on what I'd said, it was\npretty embarrassing.
'Hmph!'
'...Aoi, why are you so passionate about the\nglider?'
'Eh?'
'I just felt like asking. I don't see much\nmeaning in the glider, or in flying.'
'Even if you manage to fly, it's not like you'll\nget any money, or your test scores will improve\nor anything, right?'
'So you don't like any club that doesn't give you\nsome sort of concrete result?'
'It's inefficient. I don't understand why people\nget so involved in it.'
'Why are you trying to fly?'
That was a difficult question to answer.
I seem to remember having trouble answering the\nsame type of question about road racing.
If you believe that activities that don't earn\nyou something have no value at all, then how can\nI explain to you the value they have to me?
But... If I were to answer at all...
'I guess I just fell for it. The sky. It's so\nbig, and high, and...'
'It feels like I can reach it.'
I answered the same way I'd answered Asa before.
I don't understand any deep meaning behind my\nreasons.
But, the sky was there, and I wanted to fly in\nit. That's all.
I wasn't expecting any sort of reward for flying.
'...I can't think like that.'
'Hmm?'
'I've always been the type to measure the\nefficiency of something, and the likelihood for\nit to win or lose me something.'
'Dreams, passion, playing with friends, spending\ntime with them...'
'I don't understand it.'
'...I see.'
'I'm jealous of these windmills.'
Yoru looked at the line of windmills as she\nspoke.

'They just accept the wind without question, and
turn. I don't understand that feeling, and don't
even feel like trying, but for some reason I'm
jealous.'
'That's why I like my sister.'
'Hmm?'
'She's like a windmill, don't you think?'
Those sisters really do get along well.
That's how I saw it.
They thought about things differently, and liked\ndifferent things, but they still both liked each\nother.
I think that showed how much they cared about\neach other.
'Then why don't you spin in the wind of your\nfriends as well?'
'It's difficult. That's just not in my\ncharacter.'
This really was tough.
'Did you think I was lonely?'
'Eh?'
'I'm not tolerant of others. I'm narrow-minded,\nand petty. I realize that, you know.'
'I know it's not cute to make light of dreams.'
'...? I never thought that.'
'Eh?'
'Well, I do think it's a waste, and that it must\nbe lonely.'
'But as someone who does nothing but follow my\ndreams, I actually think that kind of thinking\nand believing is pretty cool.'
'And I do think you're both cool and cute.'
She was a bit conceited, but...
She was serious, and really did try her best at\neverything, and cared so much for her sister...
'...I wish you'd die.'
'Huh?'
'I wish you'd just die, Aoi!'
'Wha?! Why are you so mad?'
'I just told you! You're so embarrassing!!'
Aaaaaaah?!
Apparently I'd blown it again...
'And what are you walking so slowly for?! Hurry\nup and get back to work on that glider!'
'Sorry. I'm sorry I'm such an embarrassing guy.'
'Come on, I'll help make up the time that Sis\nlost for you guys!'
I kept apologizing as we went to the dock.
'Hello!'
'You're late, Aoi! Where have you been?'
'Ahaha, sorry. I ran into Yoru on the way.'
'Hello.'
'Oh, I see. But Yoru, why's your face so red?'
'?! It's nothing!!'
'It's true. Do you have a fever or something?'
'I, I'm fine!'
'I was worried too, but when I said something,\nYoru got really mad...'
'That's because...!'
'Because?'
'...N, nothing!'
'(Hmm? What's going on?)'
'(... Could it be...?)'
'Um, Yoru.'
'...Yeah?'
'Today, you came to Soaring with Aoi, right?'
'Yeah.'
'Did something happen?'
'Huh? What do you mean?'
'Well, your face was so red, I thought something\nmust have happened.'
'Eh? N, no, nothing...'
'Really?'
'Really.'
'Really really?'
'Really really really. I was just having a little\nbit of trouble, and Aoi helped me out. He was\nactually being kind of nosy...'
'So that's what happened. What sort of trouble?'

'It really wasn't a big deal. My classmates were
so insistent about my meeting them that I finally
went to see them, and then they were being kind
of a pain, and he helped me out of the
situation.'
'It makes me angry just remembering it.'
'Why?'
'W, well, he called me... C, cute!'
'...That's the first time I've ever seen someone\nget to you like that, Yoru.'
'Eh? Really?'
'Yeah.'
'Um, there's something I want to ask you. Is\nthere someone that you like?'
'...That would be pointless. There's no one. I'm\nnot interested in a relationship.'
'Really?'
'Really. Oh, but I like you, Sis. As family.'
'...I see.'
'What is it, Sis?'
'Well, um, if... Just IF... This is totally\nhypothetical...'
'Yeah?'
'If I said that I liked Aoi, what would you do?'
'Wha?!'
'I, I said it was just hypothetical!'
'I wouldn't do anything. If you really wanted a\nreaction, I might suggest that you not go after\nhim.'
'But you can't choose who you love. I'd be\nlonely, but there's nothing you could do about\nthat, I guess.'
'Really? That's it?'
'...That's it. What else would there be?'
'I see.'
'...What is it, Sis? You've been talking like\nthere's something stuck in your teeth or\nsomething.'
'...Don't worry about it, Yoru. It's not true\nanyway.'
'Huh?'
'I don't like Aoi like that.'
'Huh? You said it so meaningfully, and now you\ndeny it? And now you're telling me not to\nworry...'
'Never mind. Anyway, it isn't true! It isn't!'
'Huh? O- okay. If you say so... After all, you're\nthe one who brought it up in the first place, so\nif you say it's not true, I believe you.'
'That's settled then. Because it's totally not\ntrue. It was just hypothetical.'
'Y, yeah...'
'(Does she actually, really...?)'
'(Yoru... Maybe... She really does...)'
